Name of Agency to Which this Form Applie: U.S. Department of Energy/Energy Information Administration (EIA)
Additional Scope Comments: Energy Information Administration is a component of the Department of Energy with its own records  management office. Non-Capstone officials , staff, contractors and other support and/or administrative positions will be managed as temporary email (retained for 7 years) scheduled under  GRS 6.1, item 011 or as temporary email (retained for 3 years) scheduled under GRS 6.1, item 012.
Cutoff Instructions: Cutoff of email will be by employee tenure
Transfer Instructions: Records will be transferred when 15 years old.
Legacy Email Scope: Legacy email is not included in the Capstone categorization, as traditional records management with a print-and-file policy was followed prior to Capstone adoption.
URL to Agency Organization Chart: http://www.eia.gov/about/printer_friendly_org_chart.pdf Please see attached EIA organizational chart
Contact Information for Agency Records O: Donna Williams, EIA Records Officer Email:  Donna.Williams@eia.govTel: 202.586.3270

Name of Agency to Which this Form Applie: Department of the Army:  US Army North /Fifth Army
Additional Scope Comments: Army Corps of Engineers, RG 77, Office of the Surgeon General RG 112, Army Staff RG 319,  Army Secretariat RG 335, Army Special Operations Command  RG 338, Army Space & Missile Defense Command RG 338,  Army Surface Deployment & Distribution Command RG 338, US Army South RG 338, US Army Central RG 338,  US Army Africa RG 338, Army Materiel Command RG 544, US Army Europe RG 549, US Army Pacific RG 550, Army Training & Doctrine Command,  Army Forces Command RG 555.Other emails will be managed using standard Records Management practices based on content of the email.  They will be placed into electronic folders in the Army Records Information Management System (ARIMS).  Army is also pursuing other automated records management solutions with DOD and other DOD Components for use in automated processing of all electronic records.
Legacy Email Scope: Agency will be including legacy email dating back to 2013, as the email journaling policy defined in the Army Regulation 25-400-2 Army Records Information Management System was in place prior to Capstone.
Whom should NARA contact if there any qu: Anthony Crawley-Gibson,  Chief, Army Records Management Division, Anthony.d.crawley-gibson.civ@mail.mil,  703-428-6464

Name of Agency to Which this Form Applie: Department of the Navy, Chief of Naval Operations (CNO, OPNAV)
Additional Scope Comments: This submission is for record group 038. At this time DON will also be submitting for RG 428 and 0127. Forms for remaining DON record groups will be submitted at a future date.
Transfer Instructions: After cutoff, transfer account to Naval History and Heritage Command (NHHC) for SECNAV and U.S. Navy accounts; transfer to Administration and Resource Management Division (ARDB) for U.S. Marine Corps accounts. Unclassified email: Transfer to the National Archives 15 years after cutoff.Classified email: Transfer to the National Archives 25 years after cutoff after declassification review.
Legacy Email Scope: Agency will be including legacy email for all items being used, dating back to approximately 2010
